body.name: Shark Clean Sense Air Purifier for Bedroom and Office with HEPA Air Filter, Covers Up To 500 SQ FT,Removes Smoke, Dust, Allergens, and Pollutants, HP102
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22. Order within 17 hrs 44 mins
features: POWERFUL PURIFICATION: Pure Air Microforce uses a powerful, fast fan to deliver 4 speeds of purification based on the air quality around you.

EXCEEDS HEPA STANDARDS: Anti Allergen NANOSEAL captures more micropollutants than HEPA standards require. Trapping 99.98% of large, small, and micro sized particles (based on EST RP CC007.3, 0.1–0.2 microns). ”Allergens” refers to non living matter.
AUTOMATICALLY ADJUSTS: Clean Sense IQ tracks air quality and constantly adjusts power to maintain clean air in your home. (Measures three particle sizes: PM1, PM2.5, and PM10).
SMALL ROOM COVERAGE: Cleans up to 500 square feet based on 1 air change per hour. Perfect for smaller rooms such as bedrooms, laundry rooms, mud rooms and nurseries.
WORRY FREE ALLERGEN RELIEF: Protects your home from common air pollutants such as dust, dander, allergens and smoke. ”Allergens” refers to non living matter.
COMPACT/PORTABLE: Shark's sleek and compact design is just 6 lbs., and can fit on smaller surfaces like nightstands and desktops for portable, powerful cleaning.
FOR A GOOD NIGHT'S SLEEP: Ultra quiet performance, with dimmable lights for minimal sleep interruption.
EASY TO USE: The control panel is easy to use and displays real time air quality, filter life, fan speed, eco mode, and more.

REPLACE FILTERS: Purchase replacement filters every 6 12 months, based on continuous use. Genuine HE1FKPRO Shark Filters ensure your air purifier will function and filter properly off brand filters can lead to lower reliability and cause damage.
WHAT'S INCLUDED: Shark Air Purifier and Nanoseal HEPA Filter.
body.description: The Shark Air Purifier uses Pure Air Microforce to deliver fast, powerful, and quiet purification in a compact size. Clean Sense IQ senses air quality & auto-adjusts to improve air quality and report results in real time. A HEPA filter captures 99.98% of airborne particles like allergens*, dust, and dander (based on IEST-RP-CC007.3, 0.1-0.2 microns). Cleans up to 500 square feet. *“Allergens” refers to non-living matter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love how quiet it is even running at high speed. It has an auto feature so it’s not always running and the digital % air quality is nice. Currently have this in my bedroom and thinking of getting a second one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this air purifier with so many bells and whistles. It is especially quiet not interfering when TV watching. The best thing about it is the display showing the percentage of clean air within the room. And also the filter life being much longer than so many cheap models, which end up not being cheap from changing filters so often.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to clean the air after smoking. I use it in thecroom I smoke in, and there is no smoke smell in other parts of the house. Works amazingly! So well that I bought two to use in another room.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I have been researching for awhile to find a good air filter device. I decided to try this Shark Air Filter, after I saw an Ad for it on tv and after watching a couple of YouTube video reviews on it. I’m glad now that I choose this one. We purchased it to help with dust, pet dander and mainly to help us with our allergies in our 36ft RV. So far it has worked flawlessly. I love how you can choose an auto mode where it automatically adjust to what it senses is needed to clean the air. I also like how it has a visible readout screen on the front so you can keep and eye out on the air quality, especially when it changes colors. I had cooked some battered shrimp on the second night we had it in our air fryer and honestly, within 30 mins, you could no longer smell the shrimp in our RV. That really impressed me. Overall I would highly recommend. It is a little pricey but well worth the money. I also like that it tells you the percentage of the air filter, so you know when it needs to be changed. Great air filter so far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Automatic sensor does not detect dust, erroneously reads "100% clean air"
reviews.reviewText: The sensor only ever seems to read as less than "100% clean air" when there's smoke, like if we burn something on the stove. If run in Auto mode, that's the only time it will kick on.It seems incapable of detecting ordinary everyday dust. It will claim the air is 100% clean (and, if left in Auto Mode, basically shut itself off) even where there are dust particles visible in the air (as revealed by, for example, a bright flashlight beam).If you want it to actually suck dust out of the air most of the time, you'll need to run it in manual mode at Max or 3/4 power. Auto mode can't be trusted to actually filter out dust.It still gets 4 stars because as long as you run it in manual mode and don't trust the sensor there's nothing wrong with it. It does run more or less silently at 3/4 power or below, and at Max it is still reasonably quiet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Value for money
reviews.reviewText: I had an air purifier back in the day but questioned if it worked. It's one of those basic bedroom table one with a dial to remind me to change the filter. Haven't looked back until recently, when there were more dust accumulating on my tables, desktop, laptops, and even my phone despite only being a day.Looked around Amazon and found Shark's Air Purifier HP102. Had to review each air purifier before deciding which one fits my budget. Upon receiving mine, I left it on for 48 hours on auto, and I immediately notice a difference in air quality. It's much lighter and I can actually breathe without having to use a tissue. My dry eyes symptom also reduced significantly.I would upgrade to the larger one for 1200 square feet, but since I'm mostly upstairs in my office doing work, 500 square feet is more than sufficient. The air quality indicator gives a nice touch in my air quality in real time. The lowest it ever gotten was 83% today due to cooking downstairs in the kitchen in a 2400 square feet home.This would not work if dust already settled on the ground. A vacuum will be needed to remove that. To confirm that dust is removed, I did the sun shine test, where opening the curtains will reveal dust particles flying in the air. Noted that some may be from the curtain itself, which is no problem washing it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've had it a day and one thing-it is VERY QUIET when fan is on low or on auto mode. It is slowly filtering the air. I could do it more quickly but I like the silence. It is a compact unit, easy to put in a room, and not taking up much of a footprint- which I love. Shark products seem to be of high quality-I have several small appliances- and the prices are reasonable. Filter replacements are readily available at a nominal price.
